CatDescriptText: Charles Harrison, laborer, Lawrenceville and Arvella Rice, hotel worker, East Liberty were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 10, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you read daily and weekly newspapers and magazines regularly?  Do you think they present the news, etc., fairly and objectively, or do you believe that they are influenced in their presentation? If you believe the latter, who or what do you think influences the presentation?"  Mr. Harrison's answer reads: "Yes, I think that the presentations are fair."  Ms. Rice's answer reads: "Most of the time, they present things as they happened."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Charles Harrison wearing eyeglasses and hat, standing on Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Arvella Rice wearing sleeveless patterned shirt standing across from KQV building, Smithfield Street, Downtown
